intro: Eriocoryne, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Malvaceae. These plants are characterized by their hairy, velvety leaves that give them their common name. They are native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. Eriocoryne species typically have showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. The genus includes several species, some of which are cultivated for their ornamental value.
